description: A service restart notification is generated
whenever a service (or a process) on the 'active'
supervisor is restarted.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaRestartNotify CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaRestartReason i 1 CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaRestartService s EXAMPLE CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaRestartStateless i 1

description: The reason for most recent restart of a service on the
'active' supervisor.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaRestartReason

description: Name of the service (or process) that was restarted on
the 'active' supervisor.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaRestartService

description: Tells if the most recent restart of a service on the
'active' supervisor was 'stateless' or not.
A 'stateless' restart of a service is where no runtime
information is preserved while restarting the service.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaRestartStateless

description: A system shutdown notification is generated
whenever a system is going to shut down. The
cseHaShutDownReason, describes the reason as to
why the system is going to go down.
The description of the reason as to why the system
is going to go down.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseHaShutDownReason

description: A notification is generated whenever a software
crash occurs and a core file is generated.

event.Summary: Software crash occurred and a core file generated

description: A notification is generated whenever a software
crash occurs and a core file is generated.

event.Summary: Software crash occurred and core file $v2 generated at $v3

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseFailSwCoreNotifyExtended SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseSwCoresFileName s EXAMPLE CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseSwCorePath s EXAMPLE CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseSwCoresPID u 9999

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: This object contains the core file-name(including the
path, relative to the value in the cseSwCorePath object).
If the cseSwCorePath contains zero length octet string
then this object will contain the filename with absolute
path. If this object contains zero length octet string
then the core file is available in path identified in
cseSwCorePath.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseSwCoresFileName

description: Provides the path where the software cores are
stored on the system. The management application can
use this path to copy the cores from the system using
CISCO-FLASH-MIB.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseSwCorePath

description: The process identifier of the process that dumped the
core.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseSwCoresPID

description: A normal mode state change is generated when the system
is changed from maintenance mode to normal mode.
The maintenance mode operational state for the system.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseMaintModeState

description: A maintenance mode state change is generated when the system
is changed from normal mode to maintenance mode.
The maintenance mode operational state for the system.
variables.name: CISCO-SYSTEM-EXT-MIB::cseMaintModeState
